etymology.description: semantic 艹 (“grass; plant”) + phonetic 早; originally referred to 皂, later borrowed for “grass”, replacing 艸.
etymology.interpretation: Combines the plant semantic with the sound value of 早 to indicate a word related to vegetation while borrowing 早 for pronunciation. Historically the graph was used for 皂 and was later reassigned to the “grass” meaning, supplanting the older form 艸.

examples.chinese: 公园里的草很绿(公園裡的草很綠)。
examples.pinyin: Gōngyuán lǐ de cǎo hěn lǜ.
examples.english: The grass in the park is very green.

examples.chinese: 我先写个草稿(我先寫個草稿)。
这种草药很有用(這種草藥很有用)。
examples.english: This kind of herbal medicine is very useful.
